entries.title: Founders of bankrupt Three Arrows Capital pitch new platform for crypto debt claims
entries.description: A pitch deck for the project said the marketplace is aiming to go live by the end of February.

entries.title: Europe can learn from Biden’s Inflation Reduction Act, Spain's PM says
entries.description: The sweeping U.S. legislation was approved by U.S. lawmakers in August and includes a record $369 billion in spending on climate and energy policies.

entries.title: Manchin, Sinema and Coons meet with CEOs at private Davos luncheon for World Economic Forum
entries.description: Chris Coons discussed U.S. aid being given to Ukraine following Russia's invasion while Joe Manchin called for American energy independence, an attendee said.

entries.title: New Year, new rally: Why bitcoin is up 26% this month after a tumultuous 2022
entries.description: Bitcoin has begun 2023 on a positive note. The token climbed above $21,000 on Saturday for the first time in two months, and is up 26% month-to-date.

entries.title: How to use ‘quiet hiring’ to your advantage for a raise or promotion in 2023
entries.description: More businesses are learning into this trend to fill jobs given the ongoing talent shortage and fears of a potential recession.

entries.title: Life expectancy can have a greater impact than even record high inflation on how long your retirement savings will last
entries.description: Retirement planning involves planning for your future needs. People who have an idea how long they may live will be better prepared for retirement.

entries.title: China should set aside politics and look at Covid jab imports, world's largest vaccine maker says
entries.description: Adar Poonawalla, chief executive of the world's largest vaccine manufacturer, said China needs to "open... up to healthcare and vaccines from the West."

entries.title: OECD chief says China’s reopening ‘overwhelmingly positive’ to help tackle global inflation crisis
entries.description: OECD Secretary-General Mathias Cormann on Monday said China's reopening is "overwhelmingly positive" in the global fight to tackle surging inflation.

entries.title: Saudi Arabia can 'bridge the gap' between the U.S. and China, finance minister says
entries.description: "I really think that we need to focus on collaboration, cooperation, avoiding more geopolitical tensions," al-Jadaan told CNBC's Hadley Gamble.

entries.title: As China reopens and data surprises, economists are starting to get less gloomy
entries.description: After China's reopening and a deluge of positive data surprises, economists are upgrading their previously gloomy outlooks for the global economy.

entries.title: Soccer star Son Heung-min gives his top 3 tips for making it as a pro athlete
entries.description: Soccer star Son Heung-min shares top tips for making it as a pro athlete and the biggest lessons he's learned so far.

entries.title: IMF says fragmentation could cost global economy up to 7% of GDP
entries.description: Fragmentation across the world could cost the global economy up to 7% of GDP, according to a new report by the IMF.

entries.title: Russian gas will eventually return to Europe as nations 'forgive and forget,' Qatari energy minister says
entries.description: Gas exports from Russian state energy giant Gazprom to Switzerland and the EU fell by 55% in 2022, the company said earlier this month.

entries.title: The richest 1% of people amassed almost two-thirds of new wealth created in the last two years, Oxfam says
entries.description: Since 2020, the richest 1% of people have accumulated close to two-thirds of all new wealth created around the world, according to a new report from Oxfam.

entries.title: German Defense Minister Christine Lambrecht resigns amid Ukraine war backlash
entries.description: German Defense Minister Christine Lambrecht has resigned amid Ukraine war backlash.

entries.title: Bank of Japan could announce major policy shift this week as bond yields top limit again
entries.description: Japan's central bank will meet this week amid soaring bond yields and a strong yen, with some economists expecting it to scrap its yield curve control policy.

entries.title: 'Green' offices in London are over 25% more expensive. But a modern workforce now expects it
entries.description: A sustainable office is at the top of many companies' wish lists in light of net-zero targets, but price, scarcity and style can be barriers to relocating.

entries.title: Time to set yearly work goals? Here’s how to pick them and stick to them
entries.description: Setting work goals and completing appraisals can be intimidating. Experts explain how to approach them and achieve your targets throughout the year.

entries.title: India's wedding season is here, but for many it's no longer the bigger, the better
entries.description: Millennial couples in India are opting for more intimate wedding celebrations, but costs for food, venues and decorations remain high.
